technical_features.source_sentence: The resultant InP/ZnSe/ZnS core/shell QDs exhibit a PL peak of 534 nm, an average size of 8.1 nm and a high PL QY of 91%.
The corresponding green-emitting electroluminescence devices exhibited a maximum EQE of 12.74%, along with a luminance of over 175 000 cd m⁻².
Especially, the device obtains a luminance of over 175 000 cd m⁻² and a long T₅₀@100 cd m⁻² lifetime of over 20 000 h.
The T₅₀@100 cd m⁻² lifetime of over 20 000 h.
The average size of the cores is 2.8 nm (with ZnMy₂).
The average size for the as-prepared core/shell/shell QD with ZnMy₂ is estimated to be 8.1 ± 1.0 nm.
QDs with ZnMy₂ demonstrate [...] an FWHM of 44 nm.
The valence bands of QDs [...] with ZnMy₂ are 5.16 eV.
The device with ZnMy₂ exhibits a smaller turn-on voltage (2.0 V).
Here, we proposed a fluoride-free synthesis strategy to in-situ passivate the InP cores.

qualitative_insights.main_objective: Improve performance of green InP-based QLEDs through fluoride-free in-situ core passivation using zinc myristate
key_methodology_summary: In-situ passivation of InP cores with ZnMy₂ to form Zn-P protective layer
QLED device fabrication with ITO/PEDOT:PSS/PF8Cz/QD/ZnMgO/Al structure
primary_findings_conclusions: 91% PL quantum yield in passivated QDs
limitations_discussed_by_authors: Persistent surface defects in core/shell structures
Performance gap remains compared to cadmium-based QLEDs
future_work_suggested_by_authors: Further optimization of green InP QLED performance
Development of full-color display commercialization strategies
novelty_significance_claim: First fluoride-free passivation method for InP cores
Record luminance for green InP QLEDs
Safer alternative to HF-based synthesis methods
key_tables_figures_present: Figure 1: XPS analysis of core passivation effects
